triples.name: LangChain
triples.relevance: LangGraph is a LangChain library used to build AI agent systems that the paper reviews as a key framework.

triples.name: IBM Watsonx
triples.relevance: IBM Watsonx is an AI platform for building and managing AI applications that the paper evaluates as an enterprise solution framework.

triples.name: Agentic AI
triples.relevance: AI agents are the core focus of the review, examining frameworks that enable autonomous agent development.

triples.name: Autonomous system
triples.relevance: Autonomous systems are a fundamental concept discussed throughout the paper as the primary use case for AI agent frameworks.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents represent the core operational capability of the frameworks being reviewed.

triples.name: Business process automation
triples.relevance: Enterprise automation, a key application domain discussed in the paper, leverages business process automation concepts.

triples.name: Risk management
triples.relevance: Risk management is discussed as a real-world application domain for AI agent frameworks.

triples.name: Financial market
triples.relevance: Financial markets are cited as a key application domain where AI agents demonstrate impact.

triples.name: Latency (engineering)
triples.relevance: Latency is a quantitative metric used to evaluate and compare the performance of different AI agent frameworks.

triples.name: Network throughput
triples.relevance: Throughput is a quantitative performance metric analyzed to compare framework capabilities.

triples.name: Scalability
triples.relevance: Scalability is a critical performance characteristic evaluated across the reviewed AI agent frameworks.
